freenet.support.io
Class PersistentTempBucketFactory

java.lang.Object
  freenet.support.io.PersistentTempBucketFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
BucketFactory, PersistentFileTracker
public class PersistentTempBucketFactory
extends Object
implements BucketFactory, PersistentFileTracker

Handles persistent temp files. These are used for e.g. persistent downloads. Anything of exactly 32KB length will be stored in the blob file, otherwise these are simply temporary files in the directory specified for the PersistentFileTracker (which supports changing the directory, i.e. moving the files). These temporary files are encrypted using an ephemeral key (unless the node is configured not to encrypt temporary files as happens with physical security level LOW). Note that the files are only deleted *after* the transaction containing their deletion reaches disk - so we should not leak temporary files, or forget that we deleted a bucket and try to reuse it, if there is an unclean shutdown.

Field Detail

fg

public final FilenameGenerator fg
Filename generator. Tracks the directory and the prefix for temp files, can move them if these change, generates filenames.

Constructor Detail

PersistentTempBucketFactory

public PersistentTempBucketFactory(File dir,
                                   String prefix,
                                   RandomSource strongPRNG,
                                   Random weakPRNG,
                                   boolean encrypt,
                                   long nodeDBHandle)
                            throws IOException
Create a temporary bucket factory.

Parameters:
dir - Where to put it.
prefix - Prefix for temporary file names.
strongPRNG - Cryptographically strong random number generator, for making keys etc.
weakPRNG - Weak but fast random number generator.
encrypt - Whether to encrypt temporary files.
nodeDBHandle - The node database handle, used to find big objects in the database (such as the one and only PersistentTempBucketFactory).
Throws:
IOException - If we are unable to read the directory, etc.

register

public void register(File file)
Notify the bucket factory that a file is a temporary file, and not to be deleted. FIXME this is not currently used. @see #completedInit()

Specified by:
register in interface PersistentFileTracker

completedInit

public void completedInit()
Called when boot-up is complete. Deletes any old temp files still unclaimed.

makeBucket

public Bucket makeBucket(long size)
                  throws IOException
Create a persistent temporary bucket. Use a blob if it is exactly 32KB, otherwise use a temporary file. Encrypted if appropriate. Wrapped in a DelayedFreeBucket so that they will not be deleted until after the transaction deleting them in the database commits.

Specified by:
makeBucket in interface BucketFactory
Parameters:
size - The maximum size of the data, or -1 if we don't know. Some buckets will throw IOException if you go over this length.
Returns:
Throws:
IOException

Free an allocated bucket, but only after the change has been written to disk.

Specified by:
delayedFreeBucket in interface PersistentFileTracker
Parameters:
b - The bucket to free. Should be a DelayedFreeBucket.

load

public static PersistentTempBucketFactory load(File dir,
                                               String prefix,
                                               RandomSource random,
                                               Random fastWeakRandom,
                                               com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                                               long nodeDBHandle,
                                               boolean encrypt,
                                               DBJobRunner jobRunner,
                                               Ticker ticker)
                                        throws IOException
Load the persistent temporary bucket factory from the database, or create a new one if there is none in the database. Automatically migrate files if the dir or prefix change.

Parameters:
dir - The directory to put temporary files in.
prefix - The prefix for temporary files.
random - Strong random number generator.
fastWeakRandom - Weak PRNG.
container - The database. Must not be null, we must be running on the database thread and/or be initialising the node.
nodeDBHandle - The node database handle. Used to identify the specific PersistentTempBucketFactory for the current node. Hence it is possible to have multiple nodes share the same database, at least in theory.
encrypt - Whether to encrypt temporary buckets created. Note that if this is changed we do *not* decrypt/encrypt old buckets.
jobRunner - The DBJobRunner on which to schedule database jobs when needed.
ticker - The Ticker to run non-database jobs on.
Returns:
A persistent temporary bucket factory.
Throws:
IOException - If we cannot access the proposed directory, or some other I/O error prevents us using it.

setEncryption

public void setEncryption(boolean encrypt)
Set whether to encrypt new persistent temp buckets. Note that we do not encrypt/decrypt old ones when this changes.

preCommit

public void preCommit(com.db4o.ObjectContainer db)
Call this just before committing a transaction. Ensures that the list of buckets to free has been stored if necessary.

Parameters:
db - The database.

postCommit

public void postCommit(com.db4o.ObjectContainer db)
Call this just after committing a transaction. Deletes buckets pending deletion, and if there are lots of them, commits the transaction again.

Parameters:
db - The database.

addBlobFreeCallback

public void addBlobFreeCallback(DBJob job)
Add a callback job to be called when we are low on space in the blob temp bucket factory. For example a defragger, but there are other possibilities.

removeBlobFreeCallback

public void removeBlobFreeCallback(DBJob job)
Remove a blob temp bucket factory callback job.
